rows.label: qst701502_msg0001
rows.name:
I think I've lived a good, useful life. My
one regret is that vase I promised to
make for an old friend, and never did...

rows.label: qst701502_msg0002
rows.name:
To keep that promise, I need two sprigs
of Spiral Mistletoe, four Silverwing
Quartz and four bits of Eternity Loam.

rows.label: qst701502_msg0003
rows.name:
If you happen to find some on your
travels and feel like sharing, I'd be
most grateful.

rows.label: qst701502_msg0005
rows.name:
Oh, about that Eternity Loam.
I seem to remember that you could
harvest it in the Loftin Nature Preserve.

rows.label: qst701502_msg0006
rows.name:
These days it's very valuable, so I feel
like maybe there isn't so much of it left.
Still, it may be worth a look...

rows.label: qst701502_msg0007
rows.name:
No need to go out of your way to get
it all, but, like I said, I'd be grateful for
any help you can offer.

rows.label: qst701502_msg0008
rows.name:
I reckon my friend's forgotten all
about this, heh heh... But a promise
is a promise and I want to keep it.

rows.label: qst701502_msg0101
rows.name:
He's not exactly a spring chicken,
so he can't have gone far...

rows.label: qst701502_msg0102
rows.name:
I'm sorry... I get a little wobbly when
I start to fret.

rows.label: qst701502_msg0103
rows.name:
Pull yourself together, Mireille. You've
come this far. No sense in getting all
het up now.

rows.label: qst701502_msg0201
rows.name:
He's collapsed, you say? And he can't
breathe properly? Is he coughing?

rows.label: qst701502_msg0202
rows.name:
His throat might be inflamed. If you
don't have any medicine, you might
try herbs.

rows.label: qst701502_msg0203
rows.name:
There's a nice soothing one that smells
good and helps keep the swelling down.
What was it again...?

rows.label: qst701502_msg0204
rows.name:
Don't you sneer at my old wives'
remedies. I'm no doctor, but they've
kept me alive thus far.

rows.label: qst701502_msg0205
rows.name:
I can't walk far now, but please rescue
my husband for me.
